abstract.p: New Jersey Devils trim roster to 23 players; negotiations with holdouts Scott Niedermayer and Jason Arnott are at impasse (S)

block.p: For the first time this season, the Devils are not including Scott Niedermayer and Jason Arnott as members of the team.
The Devils trimmed their roster to 23 players yesterday as they assigned 25 players to the Albany River Rats of the American Hockey League.

Lou Lamoriello indicated that negotiations with Niedermayer and Arnott, who are restricted free agents, have come to a standstill again, even though Niedermayer expressed willingness earlier in the week to settle for less than he was proposing at the start of negotiations.

''It's like going shopping for a house and you cannot afford to pay more than you have,'' Lamoriello said yesterday. ''I said before training camp what the team can afford and I'm sticking with that.''
It now appears unlikely that either Niedermayer or Arnott will be with the team on Oct. 6, when the Devils open against Montreal.
The team will begin the season with six players who were not with them during the playoffs last season.
